required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Performance Study of the Optimum Transcatheter Aortic Valve
clinical_study.official_title: A First-in-Human Study to Access Feasibility and Safety of the Optimum Aortic Valve Implant

brief_summary.textblock: The TAVI (Thubrikar Aortic Valve, Inc.) -1 Study: Safety and Performance Study of the Optimum Transcatheter Aortic Valve- First-in-human study to assess feasibility and safety of the Optimum Aortic Valve Implant

detailed_description.textblock: The purpose of the study is to assess the safety and performance of the Optimum TAV (Transcatheter Aortic Valve) in patients with symptomatic, severe aortic stenosis who are deemed high-risk for SAVR (Surgical Aortic Valve Replacement) or have contraindications or deemed inoperable for SAVR.

primary_outcome.description: Valve deployed from delivery system successfully
Deploying a single Optimum TAV in the intended anatomical position and confirming via fluoroscopy as determined by the implanting physician

primary_outcome.measure: Intended Performance of Optimum TAV - Leaflet Function
primary_outcome.description: Evaluate leaflet function by assessing the effective orifice area (EOA) (units: cm^2) via echocardiography

primary_outcome.measure: Intended Performance of Optimum TAV - mean aortic valve gradient
primary_outcome.description: Evaluate hemodynamics by assessing the mean aortic valve gradient (units: mmHg) via echocardiography

primary_outcome.measure: Intended Performance of Optimum TAV - peak aortic valve velocity
primary_outcome.description: Evaluate hemodynamics by assessing the peak aortic valve velocity (units: m/s) via echocardiography

primary_outcome.measure: Intended Performance of Optimum TAV - Paravalvular Leak
primary_outcome.description: Evaluate proper valve sealing by assessing paravalvular leak via echocardiography and fluoroscopy. If paravalvular leak is determined, it will be classified as mild, moderate, or severe.

arm_group.description: Patients with symptomatic severe aortic stenosis that will be treated via transcatheter aortic valve implantation procedure

intervention.intervention_name: Transcatheter Aortic Valve (TAV) Implantation With The Optimum TAV System
intervention.description: Treating patients with severe symptomatic aortic stenosis via transcatheter aortic valve implantation by implanting the Optimum TAV inside the native diseased valve via a the Precision Catheter. The Optimum TAV and Precision Catheter together are the Optimum TAV System.
